name: places/ChIJxx90-6hZwokRZbGeo46UwP8
formattedAddress: 17 W 32nd St 14th Floor, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 17 W 32nd St 14th Floor, New York, NY 10001-3820, USA

editorialSummary.text: Straightforward rooms in a laid-back hotel offering a Korean dessert cafe & a 24-hour gym.

originalText.text: The hotel was a good location for the activities and access to the sights of New York.  The hotel is quite old and the rooms are small in comparison to what you might expect.   We booked 2 twin rooms and got 2 doubles.   They were great at helping fix the issue (albeit the next day).   The staff were really helpful and the maids working on the room cleaning were lovely.    It didn't exceed my expectations but didn't let me down.  We were staying in the centre of New York at a cheap price.  (Although I struggle to understand this new room tax thing that is applied now, so that hit me when I got there).

text.text: The hotel was a good location for the activities and access to the sights of New York.  The hotel is quite old and the rooms are small in comparison to what you might expect. originalText.text:
Surprise nightly fees, TINY rooms, broken furniture, loud internally and externally at night, terrible internet speeds (when there was any), and there were thick strands of hair all over my room.
Don’t let the location and beautiful lobby fool you. This is a budget hotel in a great location. Change your expectations and you may appreciate this stay.

text.text:

originalText.text: Honestly we had a great stay and we were definitely worried due to the reviews. The staff were overly helpful and kind, everything was clean. Great area to stay in and free coffee and water downstairs! The only thing was our air conditioner didn’t work and then when they came to put in a new unit, it didn’t really work either so hopefully they give attention to that. Other than that we had no issues!

text.text: Honestly we had a great stay and we were definitely worried due to the reviews. The staff were overly helpful and kind, everything was clean. Other than that we had no issues!

originalText.text:
A fairly good hotel.
Location is great,close to landmarks like Empire state building.
And there is many korean restaurants around,pharmacies,breakfast restaurants etc and close to Subway.
Rooms are abit small and hotel is abit old.
But value for money is good,they serve coffee and tea for selfservice one floor down.
Staff performance was good,helpful and friendly.
Can recommend this for anyone exploring the big apple for a few nights

originalText.text: This is not an extravagant hotel, but it is also not charging extravagant prices. The rooms were larger than most other New York hotel rooms. Especially when considering the price. Checking in before 3 is almost impossible so be prepared to hangout if you have an early trip in. Overall I was happy with my experience
